title: In October 1972, a pipeline of the Texas-New Mexico Pipeline Company burst, releasing 285,000 gallons of crude oil into the San Juan River near Shiprock, New Mexico. The oil flowed some 200 miles downstream before being contained behind a log boom west of Piute Farms, in Monument Valley, Utah. An EPA official holds up a sample of oil-drenched mud at the boom site.
